subprocess_flow.description: The first step in establishing the architecture vision is to clearly define the business goals that the architecture is intended to support. This involves gathering input from key stakeholders across the organization to understand their strategic objectives and priorities. The defined goals should be specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART) to provide a clear direction for the architecture effort.
success_criteria: Clearly defined and documented business goals
subprocess_flow.purpose: To establish a clear understanding of the business objectives that the architecture must support.

subprocess_flow.description: Identifying the strategic drivers that will influence the architecture is crucial for ensuring its relevance and effectiveness. This involves analyzing the external and internal factors that will shape the organization's future direction. These drivers may include market trends, technological advancements, regulatory changes, and competitive pressures. Understanding these drivers will help the architecture team anticipate future needs and design a flexible and adaptable architecture.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To understand the key factors that will shape the future direction of the architecture.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Regular environmental scanning and stakeholder interviews

subprocess_flow.description: Defining the constraints that will limit the architecture is essential for ensuring its feasibility and practicality. These constraints may include budget limitations, regulatory requirements, technology limitations, and resource constraints. Understanding these constraints will help the architecture team make informed decisions about the scope and design of the architecture. The constraints should be clearly documented and communicated to all stakeholders.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To understand the limitations that will impact the design and implementation of the architecture.

subprocess_flow.description: Developing a set of architecture principles is crucial for guiding the design and implementation of the architecture. These principles should be based on the business goals, strategic drivers, and constraints identified in the previous steps. The principles should be clear, concise, and easy to understand. They should also be aligned with the organization's values and culture. The architecture principles will serve as a foundation for making consistent and informed decisions about the architecture.
success_criteria: Alignment with business goals and strategic drivers
subprocess_flow.purpose: To establish a set of guiding principles for the architecture.

subprocess_flow.description: Defining the scope of the architecture is essential for ensuring that the architecture effort is focused and manageable. This involves determining the boundaries of the architecture, including the business units, IT systems, and technologies that will be included. The scope should be aligned with the business goals, strategic drivers, and constraints identified in the previous steps. The scope should be clearly documented and communicated to all stakeholders to avoid misunderstandings and ensure that the architecture effort is aligned with the organization's priorities.
success_criteria: Clearly defined and documented scope of architecture
Alignment with business goals and strategic drivers
subprocess_flow.purpose: To define the boundaries of the architecture effort.
end_conditions: Documented and approved scope of architecture
